fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.indoorgarden.sil

Class IndoorGardenStateModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.indoorgarden.sil.IndoorGardenStateModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndoorGardenOperationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.ModelDescriptionI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariablesSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={SwitchOnIndoorGarden.class,SwitchOffIndoorGarden.class,SwitchLightOnIndoorGarden.class,SwitchLightOffIndoorGarden.class},
                     exported={SwitchOnIndoorGarden.class,SwitchOffIndoorGarden.class,SwitchLightOnIndoorGarden.class,SwitchLightOffIndoorGarden.class})
public class IndoorGardenStateModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
implements IndoorGardenOperationI
    The class IndoorGardenStateModel implements the DEVS simulation model that tracks the state of the indoor garden with respect to its electricity consumption and which propagates events that changes this state to the IndoorGardenElectricityModel.

    Description

    This model is needed only to cater for SIL simulations where state changes are initiated within the IndoorGarden component but the global electricity consumption of a house is computed within the ElectricMeter component. Because electricity models are of HIOA type, they share variables and therefore must be located within the same component. So the IndoorGardenElectricityModel will be in the ElectricMeter component but actions initiating state changes are done in the IndoorGarden component. However, component methods can trigger simulation events for the simulation models they hold, but not for simulation models held by other components. Only simulation models can exchange events with models located in other components. Hence, the IndoorGardenStateModel plays the role of processing events emitted by the software in IndoorGarden to propagate them to the IndoorGardenElectricityModel located in the ElectricMeter component.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       URI != null && !URI.isEmpty()

    Created on : 2022-11-08

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
